intro: Eunanus parryi, commonly known as Parry's eunanus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it thrives in full sun. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
